topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Known Issues and Work Arounds

ul.li: Currently, in HCG dashboard, there is no provision to rerun or execute a particular role if cloud deploy fails.

Helion dashboard crashes when UI has failed cloudtemplate. Workaround is to delete the failed cloud template using the HLM CLI and re-login to the dashboard. For example: rm -r /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>
When Pipelines or Retention period settings are changed through Horizon, it takes a long time to apply the settings and will crash eventually. Try to re-login to get to Horizon dashboard.
Newly created tenants not getting listed in the dropdown menu from Horizon. Workaround is to logout of Horizon and log back.
Network address field shows default values when we edit the cloud from UI. But wr.json file shows the right updated entries.

Horizon becomes inaccessible after restarting iptables services
Workaround to fix this issue is the execute following commands on all the 3 Standard Region controllers:ifdown eth2 ; ifup eth2 service haproxy restart service keepalived restart Note: eth2 is CAN network
If you see few icons not being loaded in horizon after above workaround, it is likely because service went in to an inconsistent state. In that case, go to HCG Dashboard's "manage cloud" page and restart "wr_horizon" service and then try logging into horizon again.
To Get to HCG dashboard http://<HLM CLM IP>:8000

If you should configure your lifecycle manager as an NFS server, for example as a backup location for the Attis service, you will need to open ports in the firewall. The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process configures and starts the firewall on the lifecycle manager host.
You will need to open ports:
111
2049
4001 For rpcmount, edit the /etc/default/nfs-kernel-server file to specify a port:#RPCMOUNTDOPTS="--manage-gids" RPCMOUNTDOPTS="-p 4001 -g"Then, stop and restart services in the following order:/etc/init.d/rpcbind stop /etc/init.d/nfs-common stop /etc/init.d/nfs-kernel-server stop /etc/init.d/rpcbind start /etc/init.d/nfs-kernel-server start /etc/init.d/nfs-common start
